definition: to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to be in charge in one's own house (idiom)/to be the master of one's own affairs
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative

sentences.english: The people are the masters of their country.
It is the striking theme of the ruling history and country history that people are the masters.
sentences.chinese: 人民当家作主成为党的执政史和国史的鲜明主题。

sentences.english: Or, are you still trying to be God in their life.
sentences.chinese: 或者，你还试图在他们的生命中作主。

sentences.english: It is the mechanism of "authority-propelled press freedom".
sentences.chinese: 笔者分析的理论框架是权威主义和合作主义理论。

sentences.english: Our goal is to lead people to know Jesus and "make disciples of all nations".
sentences.chinese: 本会的目标是领人归主及使万民作主的门徒。

sentences.english: You're the shrink. I'm not big on self-affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 你才是心理医生，我才不会那么自作主张。

sentences.english: Brook It implies self-assertion and defiance.
Lightman : You're the shrink . I'm not big on self- affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 你才是心理医生，我才不会那么自作主张。

sentences.english: Kept hearts in liveries , but mine own was free.
sentences.chinese: 我的心却仍贵如王侯，自己作主。

sentences.english: He is such a big thing three dare to liu in charge.
sentences.chinese: 他气的是这么大的事刘三竟敢私自作主。

sentences.english: For some reason, this attendant bought the horse's bones with half of the gold he took.
sentences.chinese: 侍臣自作主张用五百两黄金买了死马的马骨。

sentences.english: Some people prosper before others. The basis of socialism is public ownership of means of production.
sentences.chinese: 社会主义的基础是公有制，人民当家作主，共同致富。

sentences.english: Bennigsen, on his own responsibility, ordered the troops to be moved on to the high-road.
sentences.chinese: 贝尼格森自作主张，命令把军队都转移到高地上去。

sentences.english: Jade home woke up and found wei macro self-assertion, were passed out again.
sentences.chinese: 玉家醒来，发现伟宏自作主张，被气得又再昏倒。

sentences.english: It seems that there's someone else in charge of us, he felt strange but also very pity.
sentences.chinese: 似乎是我们系作主的换了，他觉得很奇怪也很遗憾。

sentences.english: Mastered by Christ, you can handle anything.
sentences.chinese: 让基督作主，你能处理任何事。

definition: see 作主[zuo4 zhu3]
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to have the final say/to be the one in charge
to make a decision/to determine
to offer an opinion/to comment (on the issue)/to have a say (in the matter)
to do sth in place of sb else
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to arrange matters
to consider and decide
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to give one's assent/to consent
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
to intercede/to plead for sb else
